College: I graduated HS in 2012 and had no idea what i wanted to do. Ended up doing like 3 semester and flunking my 4th because I wasn't motivated. If i could go back i would just finished an associates degree like everyone told me too because now that I know what i want I have to finished my associates degree. Everything is much harder now; bills, responsibilities, no financial support, etc.

Being a identical twin let me just say I've never telepathically talked to my twin and Ive never known any twin who has. Also if He gets hurt i don't. We are 2 different people.

Yes I'm 24, no I'm not 17. Here you want to see my license. Yes I can drive, no I dont live with my parents, and no I graduated high school years ago (and yes I need full-time, i can work day shifts). I don't know why but being a guy I f-ing hate looking so much younger. people generally don't respect you as much and the only girls that give you attention are 6+ years younger.

Two things.
1. I have glaucoma and im 24, diagnosed at 18. I have to take eye drops twice a day. So the problem Is my eyes are really sensitive. Nothing helps,. So the eyes drops make my eyes blood red 24/7. Coworkers, bosses,etc are always questioning me. I've never smoked pot in my life and I'm tired of being judged and questioned on it. Plus when I say I have glaucoma less then half believe me.
2. Ok, I'm 24 male who looks 17. I get asked which grade I'm in high school or if I'm old enough to sell alcohol, etc. I get asked every day things like "you drive?!" or "what's ur mom making for supper?" haha
omg that was a typo. i meant wasn't*
